intro: Hapalorchis rhombiglossa, commonly known as the rhombic-tongued liverwort, is a type of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its small, leafy structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive rhombic shape to its leaf lobes, which gives it its common name. It is often found growing on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Hapalorchis rhombiglossa is a non-vascular plant that lacks true roots, stems, and leaves in the traditional sense.
